snippet: Outrage is growing over revelations that officials and their confederates have accumulated dozens, if not scores, of homes in China.
abstract: Chinese police say they have detained Gong Aiai, former vice president of the Shenmu Rural Commercial Bank in the northwestern province of Shaanxi, on charges of forging identity papers and other documents in order to accumulate dozens of houses and other properties; case strikes raw nerve with millions of Chinese who are outraged over graft and high cost of homes.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Outrage is growing over revelations that officials and their confederates have accumulated dozens, if not scores, of homes in China.

headline.seo: ‘House Sister’ Detained in Chinese Graft Case
headline.main: ‘House Sister,’ Collector of Properties, Held in Chinese Graft Case
headline.print_headline: ‘House Sister,’ Collector of Properties, Held in Chinese Graft Case
